meanings.definition: The act of disbursing money or funds.
meanings.sent1: The disbursal of the charity funds helped many families in need.
meanings.sent2: The company's disbursal of bonuses boosted employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The disbursal of allowance money to the kids always leads to big smiles.
meanings.sent4: Her quick disbursal of snacks at the party was like magic to the hungry guests.
meanings.sent5: The disbursal of seeds in the garden ensured a colorful bloom in spring.

meanings.definition: The distribution or payment of money or resources.
meanings.sent1: The timely disbursal of supplies to the disaster-stricken area saved lives.
meanings.sent2: The government's disbursal of aid to farmers helped them recover from the drought.
meanings.sent3: The disbursal of treats at the party made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: His disbursal of knowledge to the students was like planting seeds of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The swift disbursal of umbrellas prevented anyone from getting wet in the sudden rain.
